alert.note: Alert for Logan; Madison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 5:22PM EST until March 03 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Delaware, Franklin OH, Madison and Union OH. In West Central Ohio, Champaign, Clark, Hardin and Logan. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM EST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Delaware, Marysville, Worthington, Bellefontaine, Urbana, Kenton, Northridge, Powell, Sunbury, Plain City, Richwood, St. Paris, West Liberty, Mechanicsburg, North Lewisburg, Russells Point and Ashley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
